meanings.definition: The quality or state of being spiny.
meanings.sent1: The cactus's spinosity made it difficult to touch.
meanings.sent2: The hedgehog's spinosity protected it from predators.
meanings.sent3: The spinosity of the porcupine made it the star of the animal fashion show.
meanings.sent4: Her personality had a spinosity that kept others at a distance.
meanings.sent5: The spinosity of the sea urchin was a natural defense mechanism.

meanings.definition: The presence of spines or thorns.
meanings.sent1: The rose's spinosity made it a beautiful but prickly flower.
meanings.sent2: The cactus's spinosity was a defense against herbivores.
meanings.sent3: The spinosity of the hedgehog made it a challenging pet to cuddle.
meanings.sent4: The spinosity of the thorn bush reminded her of life's obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The spinosity of the porcupine was both protective and intimidating.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having sharp projections or points.
meanings.sent1: The spinosity of the barbed wire fence kept intruders out.
meanings.sent2: The spinosity of the starfish's arms helped it catch prey.
meanings.sent3: The spinosity of the crown of thorns plant was both fascinating and dangerous.
meanings.sent4: The spinosity of the mountain range created a stunning silhouette against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The spinosity of the metal sculpture added an edgy element to the garden.
